00034 /** @file ctx.h
00035     @brief Declaration of the FunctionEmitContext class
00036 */
00037 
00038 #ifndef ISPC_CTX_H
00039 #define ISPC_CTX_H 1
00040 
00041 #include "ispc.h"
00042 #include <llvm/InstrTypes.h>
00043 #include <llvm/Instructions.h>
00044 #ifndef LLVM_2_8
00045 #include <llvm/Analysis/DIBuilder.h>
00046 #endif
00047 #include <llvm/Analysis/DebugInfo.h>
00048 
00049 struct CFInfo;
00050 
00051 /** FunctionEmitContext is one of the key classes in ispc; it is used to
00052     help with emitting the intermediate representation of a function during
00053     compilation.  It carries information the current program context during
00054     IR emission (e.g. the basic block into which instructions should be
00055     added; or, the current source file and line number, so debugging
00056     symbols can be correctly generated).  This class also provides a number
00057     of helper routines that are useful for code that emits IR.
00058  */
00059 class FunctionEmitContext {
00060 public:
00061     /** Create a new FunctionEmitContext.
00062         @param returnType   The return type of the function
00063         @param function     LLVM function in the current module that corresponds
00064                             to the function
00065         @param funSym       Symbol that corresponds to the function
00066         @param firstStmtPos Source file position of the first statement in the
00067                             function
00068      */
00069     FunctionEmitContext(const Type *returnType, llvm::Function *function, Symbol *funSym,
00070                         SourcePos firstStmtPos);
00071     ~FunctionEmitContext();
00072 
00073     /** @name Current basic block management
00074         @{
00075      */
00076     /** Returns the current basic block pointer */ 
00077     llvm::BasicBlock *GetCurrentBasicBlock();
00078     
00079     /** Set the given llvm::BasicBlock to be the basic block to emit
00080         forthcoming instructions into. */
00081     void SetCurrentBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock *bblock);
00082 
00083     /** @name Mask management
00084         @{
00085      */
00086     /** Returns the current mask value */ 
00087     llvm::Value *GetMask();
00088 
00089     /** Provides the value of the mask at function entry */
00090     void SetEntryMask(llvm::Value *val);
00091 
00092     /** Sets the mask to a new value */
00093     void SetMask(llvm::Value *val);
00094 
00095     /** Sets the mask to (oldMask & val) */
00096     void MaskAnd(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *val);
00097 
00098     /** Sets the mask to (oldMask & ~val) */
00099     void MaskAndNot(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *test);
00100 
00101     /** Emits a branch instruction to the basic block btrue if any of the
00102         lanes of current mask are on and bfalse if none are on. */
00103     void BranchIfMaskAny(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse);
00104 
00105     /** Emits a branch instruction to the basic block btrue if all of the
00106         lanes of current mask are on and bfalse if none are on. */
00107     void BranchIfMaskAll(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse);
00108 
00109     /** Emits a branch instruction to the basic block btrue if none of the
00110         lanes of current mask are on and bfalse if none are on. */
00111     void BranchIfMaskNone(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse);
00112     /** @} */
00113 
00114     /** @name Control flow management
00115         @{
00116     */
00117     /** Notifies the FunctionEmitContext that we're starting emission of an
00118         'if' statement with a uniform test.  The value of the mask going
00119         into the 'if' statement is provided in the oldMask parameter. */
00120     void StartUniformIf(llvm::Value *oldMask);
00121 
00122     /** Notifies the FunctionEmitContext that we're starting emission of an
00123         'if' statement with a varying test.  The value of the mask going
00124         into the 'if' statement is provided in the oldMask parameter. */
00125     void StartVaryingIf(llvm::Value *oldMask);
00126 
00127     /** Notifies the FunctionEmitConitext that we're done emitting the IR
00128         for an 'if' statement. */
00129     void EndIf();
00130 
00131     /** Notifies the FunctionEmitContext that we're starting to emit IR
00132         for a loop.  Basic blocks are provides for where 'break' and
00133         'continue' statements should jump to (if all running lanes want to
00134         break or continue), uniformControlFlow indicates whether the loop
00135         condition is 'uniform', and oldMask provides the current mask going
00136         into the loop. */
00137     void StartLoop(llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget, llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget, 
00138                    bool uniformControlFlow, llvm::Value *oldMask);
00139 
00140     /** Informs FunctionEmitContext of the value of the mask at the start
00141         of a loop body. */
00142     void SetLoopMask(llvm::Value *mask);
00143 
00144     /** Informs FunctionEmitContext that code generation for a loop is
00145         finished. */
00146     void EndLoop();
00147 
00148     /** Emit code for a 'break' statement in a loop.  If doCoherenceCheck
00149         is true, then if we're in a 'varying' loop, code will be emitted to
00150         see if all of the lanes want to break, in which case a jump to the
00151         break target will be taken.  (For 'uniform' loops, the jump is
00152         always done). */
00153     void Break(bool doCoherenceCheck);
00154 
00155     /** Emit code for a 'continue' statement in a loop.  If
00156         doCoherenceCheck is true, then if we're in a 'varying' loop, code
00157         will be emitted to see if all of the lanes want to continue, in
00158         which case a jump to the continue target will be taken.  (For
00159         'uniform' loops, the jump is always done). */
00160     void Continue(bool doCoherenceCheck);
00161 
00162     /** This method is called by code emitting IR for a loop at the end of
00163         the loop body; it restores the lanes of the mask that executed a
00164         'continue' statement when going through the loop body in the
00165         previous iteration. */
00166     void RestoreContinuedLanes();
00167 
00168     /** Returns the current number of nested levels of 'varying' control
00169         flow */
00170     int VaryingCFDepth() const;
00171 
00172     /** Called to generate code for 'return' statement; value is the
00173         expression in the return statement (if non-NULL), and
00174         doCoherenceCheck indicates whether instructions should be generated
00175         to see if all of the currently-running lanes have returned (if
00176         we're under varying control flow).  */
00177     void CurrentLanesReturned(Expr *value, bool doCoherenceCheck);
00178     /** @} */
00179 
00180     /** @name Small helper/utility routines
00181         @{ 
00182     */
00183     /** Given a boolean mask value of type LLVMTypes::MaskType, return an
00184         i1 value that indicates if any of the mask lanes are on. */
00185     llvm::Value *Any(llvm::Value *mask);
00186 
00187     /** Given a boolean mask value of type LLVMTypes::MaskType, return an
00188         i1 value that indicates if all of the mask lanes are on. */
00189     llvm::Value *All(llvm::Value *mask);
00190 
00191     /** Given a boolean mask value of type LLVMTypes::MaskType, return an
00192         i32 value wherein the i'th bit is on if and only if the i'th lane
00193         of the mask is on. */
00194     llvm::Value *LaneMask(llvm::Value *mask);
00195 
00196     /** Given two masks of type LLVMTypes::MaskType, return an i1 value
00197         that indicates whether the two masks are equal. */
00198     llvm::Value *MasksAllEqual(llvm::Value *mask1, llvm::Value *mask2);
00199 
00200     /** Given a string, create an anonymous global variable to hold its
00201         value and return the pointer to the string. */
00202     llvm::Value *GetStringPtr(const std::string &str);
00203 
00204     /** Create a new basic block with given name */
00205     llvm::BasicBlock *CreateBasicBlock(const char *name);
00206 
00207     /** Given a vector with element type i1, return a vector of type
00208         LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType.  This method handles the conversion for
00209         the targets where the bool vector element type is, for example,
00210         i32. */
00211     llvm::Value *I1VecToBoolVec(llvm::Value *b);
00212 
00213     /** Emit code to call the user-supplied ISPCMalloc function to
00214         allocate space for an object of thee given type.  Returns the
00215         pointer value returned by the ISPCMalloc call. */
00216     llvm::Value *EmitMalloc(const llvm::Type *ty);
00217 
00218     /** Emit code to call the user-supplied ISPCFree function, passing it
00219         the given pointer to storage previously allocated by an
00220         EmitMalloc() call. */
00221     void EmitFree(llvm::Value *ptr);
00222 
00223     /** If the user has asked to compile the program with instrumentation,
00224         this inserts a callback to the user-supplied instrumentation
00225         function at the current point in the code. */
00226     void AddInstrumentationPoint(const char *note);
00227     /** @} */
00228 
00229     /** @name Debugging support
00230         @{
00231     */
00232     /** Set the current source file position; subsequent emitted
00233         instructions will have this position associated with them if
00234         debugging information is being generated. */
00235     void SetDebugPos(SourcePos pos);
00236 
00237     SourcePos GetDebugPos() const;
00238 
00239     /** Adds debugging metadata to the given instruction.  If pos == NULL,
00240         use FunctionEmitContext::currentPos as the source file position for
00241         the instruction.  Similarly, if a DIScope is provided, it's used
00242         and otherwise the scope is found from a GetDIScope() call.  This
00243         takes a llvm::Value for the instruction rather than an
00244         llvm::Instruction for convenience; in calling code we often have
00245         Instructions stored using Value pointers; the code here returns
00246         silently if it's not actually given an instruction. */
00247     void AddDebugPos(llvm::Value *instruction, const SourcePos *pos = NULL, 
00248                      llvm::DIScope *scope = NULL);
00249 
00250     /** Inform the debugging information generation code that a new scope
00251         is starting in the source program. */
00252     void StartScope();
00253 
00254     /** Inform the debugging information generation code that the current
00255         scope is ending in the source program. */
00256     void EndScope();
00257 
00258     /** Returns the llvm::DIScope corresponding to the current program
00259         scope. */
00260     llvm::DIScope GetDIScope() const;
00261 
00262     /** Emits debugging information for the variable represented by
00263         sym.  */
00264     void EmitVariableDebugInfo(Symbol *sym);
00265 
00266     /** Emits debugging information for the function parameter represented
00267         by sym.  */
00268     void EmitFunctionParameterDebugInfo(Symbol *sym);
00269     /** @} */
00270 
00271     /** @name IR instruction emission
00272         @brief These methods generally closely correspond to LLVM IR
00273         instructions.  See the LLVM assembly language reference manual
00274         (http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html) and the LLVM doxygen documentaion
00275         (http://llvm.org/doxygen) for more information.  Here we will only
00276         document significant generalizations to the functionality of the 
00277         corresponding basic LLVM instructions.
00278 
00279         Beyond actually emitting the instruction, the implementations of
00280         these methods in FunctionEmitContext also handle adding debugging
00281         metadata if debugging symbols are enabled, adding the instructions
00282         to the current basic block, and handling generalizations like
00283         'varying' lvalues, arithmetic operations with VectorType operands,
00284         etc.
00285         @{
00286     */
00287     /** Emit the binary operator given by the inst parameter.  If
00288         llvm::Values corresponding to VectorTypes are given as operands,
00289         this also handles applying the given operation to the vector
00290         elements. */
00291     llvm::Value *BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst,
00292                                 llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, 
00293                                 const char *name = NULL);
00294 
00295     /** Emit the "not" operator.  Like BinaryOperator(), this also handles
00296         a VectorType-based operand. */
00297     llvm::Value *NotOperator(llvm::Value *v, const char *name = NULL);
00298 
00299     /** Emit a comparison instruction.  If the operands are VectorTypes,
00300         then a value for the corresponding boolean VectorType is
00301         returned. */
00302     llvm::Value *CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::OtherOps inst, 
00303                          llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred,
00304                          llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, const char *name = NULL);
00305 
00306     llvm::Value *BitCastInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type,
00307                              const char *name = NULL);
00308     llvm::Value *PtrToIntInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type,
00309                               const char *name = NULL);
00310     llvm::Value *IntToPtrInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type,
00311                               const char *name = NULL);
00312     llvm::Instruction *TruncInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type,
00313                                  const char *name = NULL);
00314     llvm::Instruction *CastInst(llvm::Instruction::CastOps op, llvm::Value *value,
00315                                 const llvm::Type *type, const char *name = NULL);
00316     llvm::Instruction *FPCastInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type, 
00317                                   const char *name = NULL);
00318     llvm::Instruction *SExtInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type, 
00319                                 const char *name = NULL);
00320     llvm::Instruction *ZExtInst(llvm::Value *value, const llvm::Type *type, 
00321                                 const char *name = NULL);
00322 
00323     /** This GEP method is a generalization of the standard one in LLVM; it
00324         supports both uniform and varying basePtr values (an array of
00325         pointers) as well as uniform and varying index values (arrays of
00326         indices). */
00327     llvm::Value *GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, llvm::Value *index0,
00328                                    llvm::Value *index1, const char *name = NULL);
00329 
00330     /** This is a convenience method to generate a GEP instruction with
00331         indices with values with known constant values as the ispc program
00332         is being compiled. */
00333     llvm::Value *GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, int v0, int v1,
00334                                    const char *name = NULL);
00335 
00336     /** Load from the memory location(s) given by lvalue.  The lvalue may
00337         be varying, in which case this corresponds to a gather from the
00338         multiple memory locations given by the array of pointer values
00339         given by the lvalue.  If the lvalue is not varying, then the type
00340         parameter may be NULL. */
00341     llvm::Value *LoadInst(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type,
00342                           const char *name = NULL);
00343 
00344     /** Emits an alloca instruction to allocate stack storage for the given
00345         type.  If a non-zero alignment is specified, the object is also
00346         allocated at the given alignment.  By default, the alloca
00347         instruction is added at the start of the function in the entry
00348         basic block; if it should be added to the current basic block, then
00349         the atEntryBlock parameter should be false. */ 
00350     llvm::Value *AllocaInst(const llvm::Type *llvmType, const char *name = NULL,
00351                             int align = 0, bool atEntryBlock = true);
00352 
00353     /** Standard store instruction; for this variant, the lvalue must be a
00354         single pointer, not a varying lvalue. */
00355     void StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue, 
00356                    const char *name = NULL);
00357 
00358     /** In this variant of StoreInst(), the lvalue may be varying.  If so,
00359         this corresponds to a scatter.  Whether the lvalue is uniform of
00360         varying, the given storeMask is used to mask the stores so that
00361         they only execute for the active program instances. */
00362     void StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
00363                    llvm::Value *storeMask, const Type *rvalueType,
00364                    const char *name = NULL);
00365 
00366     void BranchInst(llvm::BasicBlock *block);
00367     void BranchInst(llvm::BasicBlock *trueBlock, llvm::BasicBlock *falseBlock,
00368                     llvm::Value *test);
00369 
00370     /** This convenience method maps to an llvm::ExtractElementInst if the
00371         given value is a llvm::VectorType, and to an llvm::ExtractValueInst
00372         otherwise. */
00373     llvm::Value *ExtractInst(llvm::Value *v, int elt, const char *name = NULL);
00374 
00375     /** This convenience method maps to an llvm::InsertElementInst if the
00376         given value is a llvm::VectorType, and to an llvm::InsertValueInst
00377         otherwise. */
00378     llvm::Value *InsertInst(llvm::Value *v, llvm::Value *eltVal, int elt, 
00379                             const char *name = NULL);
00380 
00381     llvm::PHINode *PhiNode(const llvm::Type *type, int count, const char *name = NULL);
00382     llvm::Instruction *SelectInst(llvm::Value *test, llvm::Value *val0,
00383                                   llvm::Value *val1, const char *name = NULL);
00384 
00385     llvm::Instruction *CallInst(llvm::Function *func, 
00386                                 const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &args,
00387                                 const char *name = NULL);
00388     /** This is a convenience method that issues a call instruction to a
00389         function that takes just a single argument. */
00390     llvm::Instruction *CallInst(llvm::Function *func, llvm::Value *arg,
00391                                 const char *name = NULL);
00392 
00393     /** This is a convenience method that issues a call instruction to a
00394         function that takes two arguments. */
00395     llvm::Instruction *CallInst(llvm::Function *func, llvm::Value *arg0,
00396                                 llvm::Value *arg1, const char *name = NULL);
00397 
00398     /** Launch an asynchronous task to run the given function, passing it
00399         he given argument values. */
00400     llvm::Instruction *LaunchInst(llvm::Function *callee, 
00401                                   std::vector<llvm::Value *> &argVals);
00402 
00403     llvm::Instruction *ReturnInst();
00404     /** @} */
00405 
00406 private:
00407     /** The basic block into which we add any alloca instructions that need
00408         to go at the very start of the function. */
00409     llvm::BasicBlock *allocaBlock;
00410 
00411     /** The current basic block into which we're emitting new
00412         instructions */
00413     llvm::BasicBlock *bblock;
00414 
00415     /** Pointer to stack-allocated memory that stores the current value of
00416         the program mask. */
00417     llvm::Value *maskPtr;
00418 
00419     /** Current source file position; if debugging information is being
00420         generated, this position is used to set file/line information for
00421         instructions. */
00422     SourcePos currentPos;
00423 
00424     /** Source file position where the function definition started.  Used
00425         for error messages and debugging symbols. */
00426     SourcePos funcStartPos;
00427 
00428     /** Type of result that the current function returns. */
00429     const Type *returnType;
00430 
00431     /** Value of the program mask when the function starts execution.  */
00432     llvm::Value *entryMask;
00433 
00434     /** If currently in a loop body, the value of the mask at the start of
00435         the loop. */
00436     llvm::Value *loopMask;
00437 
00438     /** If currently in a loop body, this is a pointer to memory to store a
00439         mask value that represents which of the lanes have executed a
00440         'break' statement.  If we're not in a loop body, this should be
00441         NULL. */
00442     llvm::Value *breakLanesPtr;
00443 
00444     /** Similar to breakLanesPtr, if we're inside a loop, this is a pointer
00445         to memory to record which of the program instances have executed a
00446         'continue' statement. */
00447     llvm::Value *continueLanesPtr;
00448 
00449     /** If we're inside a loop, this gives the basic block immediately
00450         after the current loop, which we will jump to if all of the lanes
00451         have executed a break statement or are otherwise done with the
00452         loop. */
00453     llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget;
00454 
00455     /** If we're inside a loop, this gives the block to jump to if all of
00456         the running lanes have executed a 'continue' statement. */
00457     llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget;
00458 
00459     /** A pointer to memory that records which of the program instances
00460         have executed a 'return' statement (and are thus really truly done
00461         running any more instructions in this functions. */
00462     llvm::Value *returnedLanesPtr;
00463 
00464     /** A pointer to memory to store the return value for the function.
00465         Since difference program instances may execute 'return' statements
00466         at different times, we need to accumulate the return values as they
00467         come in until we return for real. */
00468     llvm::Value *returnValuePtr;
00469 
00470     /** The CFInfo structure records information about a nesting level of
00471         control flow.  This vector lets us see what control flow is going
00472         around outside the current position in the function being
00473         emitted. */
00474     std::vector<CFInfo *> controlFlowInfo;
00475 
00476     /** DIFile object corresponding to the source file where the current
00477         function was defined (used for debugging info0. */
00478     llvm::DIFile diFile;
00479 
00480     /** DISubprogram corresponding to this function (used for debugging
00481         info). */
00482     llvm::DISubprogram diFunction;
00483 
00484     /** These correspond to the current set of nested scopes in the
00485         function. */
00486     std::vector<llvm::DILexicalBlock> debugScopes;
00487 
00488     /** True if a 'launch' statement has been encountered in the function. */
00489     bool launchedTasks;
00490 
00491     llvm::Value *pointerVectorToVoidPointers(llvm::Value *value);
00492     static void addGSMetadata(llvm::Instruction *inst, SourcePos pos);
00493     bool ifsInLoopAllUniform() const;
00494     void jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(llvm::BasicBlock *target);
00495     llvm::Value *emitGatherCallback(llvm::Value *lvalue, llvm::Value *retPtr);
00496 
00497     void restoreMaskGivenReturns(llvm::Value *oldMask);
00498 
00499     void scatter(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue, 
00500                  llvm::Value *maskPtr, const Type *rvalueType);
00501     llvm::Value *gather(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type,
00502                         const char *name);
00503     void maskedStore(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
00504                      const Type *rvalueType, llvm::Value *maskPtr);
00505 };
